Posts.Content: Hi just wondering if anyone has had a triple positive result.  I finally got my hormone receptor results through yesterday and yet again it seems to me to be another kick in the teeth.  The consultant said this just proves how aggressive it is and when pushed for some statistics he told me that without drug therapy and just the chemo and rads I had a 20% chance of spread.  Even after 8 x chem, 5 weeks of rads, herceptin and tamoxifen I still have a 10% chance of spread.  I am going for a CT scan and MRI today and praying that there has been no spread already. So very down at the moment - even spent all night in bed thinking of things I need to do such as power of attorney and funeral, etc.  Dramatic I know but I just feel this is the beginning of the end.
Posts.Title: Triple Postive Result

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying.  Good to hear you are still keeping well. My consultant told me only 5% of breast cancers are triple positive so it is good to hear (if you know what I mean) that I'm not the only one.
Posts.Title: Grade 3, ER+ PR+ HER2+

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed with a grade 3 ER, PR HER2+ breast cancer in March and have had my lumpectomy and have had my first session of chemo.  I am having 8 x FEC followed by 25 radiotherapy, Herceptin and Tamoxifen.  Has anyone else had the same result and did you have FEC chemo or FECT.  Was reading on an American site that there seem to be better prognosis with Taxotere added in.  My consultant told me this is very aggressive and I am wondering has anyone had the same diagnosis and still hasn't had a recurrence/spread.   Thank you.
Posts.Title: Grade 3, ER+ PR+ HER2+

Posts.Content: I have 3 children (15, 12 and 7) and to be honest they have taken the hair loss completely in their stride. I did tell them before hand that mummy was going to lose her hair. My 15 and 12 year old know why, my 7 year old just knows that the medicine mummy is getting to make her better makes her hair fall out. I have had 3 FEC and am now more or less completely bald. I only wear my wig for work, church, etc and wear a scarf for school runs, shops. At home I usually go completely bald (except when the door knocks, lol). My youngest told me the other day she loved me with hair and without hair which just made my heart melt.
Posts.Title: Telling Young Children About Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Hi Jan, Hope you don't mind but I have also sent you a friend request. Can you add me to the Group too? Thanks Lynn
Posts.Title: facebook

Posts.Content: Hi Louise I had a lumpectomy just over 3 weeks ago with clear margins and sentinel node clear and no LVI.  My tumour was 1.7 cm.  My surgeon said to consider the chemotherapy so I went to the oncologist thinking I had a choice.  The oncologist didn't offer me a choice.  I am 44.  I am due to start 8 x fec chemo followed by 5 weeks of radiotherapy and my hormone receptor test has come back triple positive so I am to have herceptin and tamoxifen.  Just wonder if perhaps it was to do with the grade of your tumour.  Mine was Grade 3 which they said was aggressive.  My surgeon did say as far as he was concerned he had got it all and in his words if he put me on a desert island now I would probably do fine, however, he said I may be one of those people who chemo would help. Feel free to add me as a friend if you want any more info. L
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Hi Dorethee, You are bound to feel nervous. I was manic before my first one. Are you having chemo with Healthcare at Home? If so they don't phone until the evening before which can be quite annoying but the nurses are all lovely. good luck tomorrow. L
Posts.Title: aaarrgh - day before ...

Posts.Content: My periods didn't stop until after my 3rd chemo. I am now heading towards chemo no 7 and haven't had a period since no. 3 so they may well stop the further along the chemo route you go.
Posts.Title: Periods during chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Winston, l I am on Tamoxifen (not sure if this is the same as Arimidex) and I have been on it since 1st October. When I first started I felt very unwell, dizzy, sick and exhausted. I wasn't sure if it was an after effect of the chemo or the Tamoxifen or in fact the rads which I started the same day as the Tamoxifen but I found the odd feelings disappeared after about 3 weeks and I feel fine now. My only side effect is hot flushes and I feel a bit stiff and achey at times. I'm also from school of 2012 although never posted very much. Hope you start to feel better soon. L
Posts.Title: Side effects with Anastrozole (Armidex)

Posts.Content: I really can't believe the insensitivity of some people.  The best comment I had was from a colleague she told me 'Well at least you are going to get some time off, I'll still be stuck here'.  I was going to offer to swap places.
Posts.Title: How to make a woman going through chemo feel so much better...

Posts.Content: Hi I have had my picc line now for about 6 weeks and to be honest the tubigrip the hospital gave me was a bit rubbish.  It kept slipping off.  However, the nurse that comes every week to clean it gave me a diffiult tubigrip which is more snug and doesn't move at all.  She gives me a fresh one each week and I have had no problems at all keeps everything where it should be. Good luck with your chemo.  I have had 2 cycles so far and like you need radiotherapy and herceptin although I need Tamoxifen as well (probably cos I'm a greedy guts, lol). L
Posts.Title: picc line cover?

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm in Northern Ireland so it may be a bit different here. I wasn't entitled to a free wig as I am having my care through BUPA but I had the choice of 2 places which sell wigs. I got mine at my local Macmillan Centre and they had lots of different styles and colours to choose from. They they fitted it and trimmed it to suit me. Mine is monofibre and actually looks very good. Some of them were part monofibre and they definitely looked like wigs. I can alter the parting of mine some of them can only be worn one way. I had mine fitted a few days before my first chemo and my hair fell out 17 days after my first chemo. I alternate between my wig and scarves as I don't find it that comfortable. It cost me just over £200 but that included the shampoo, conditioner, brush, etc. Sorry for all one paragraph for some reason it won't let me put paragraphs in. L
Posts.Title: Wig business

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, I was on an extremely high dose of antibiotics just after my third FEC for tonsillitis and I have had tonsillitis plenty of times before but to be honest this time it knocked me completely off my feet. I felt absolutely rotten. I assume because our resistence is so low any infection can take hold and make us feel even worse than normal. I only started to feel better after the antibiotics were finished. I can't answer your question about 'what else they are looking for' but I know my mum had a kidney infection a couple of months ago and they sent her sample away to check she was on the correct antibiotics for the infection. L
Posts.Title: Help, I'm worrying myself sick!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Danielle, Firstly sorry this is all in one paragraph. This site doesn't allow me to 'enter'. Anyway sorry you didn't have a reply to your first message. I know this site has been playing up for some and not all messages seem to be coming through. I had a lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy in March and am just about to have my 4th chemo (half way) on Wednesday. I didn't have the option of the cold cap as I'm having chemo at home so I am a bit like a billiard ball at the moment. Hopefully you will feel a bit better as things move along. You will start to feel better when the anaesthetic is out of your system but just rest up until then. Feel free to add me as a friend or message me. We are all here for you. L
Posts.Title: had my lumpectomy yesturday

Posts.Content: Hi, Well i'm a GG and I honestly can't notice a huge difference that is part of the reason why I am querying that he didn't just do a lumpectomy. The dr after the op said 'oh you had the quadrectomy' and they asked me to carry my notes from one department to another so I stopped to have a read (nosey me never) and it clearly stated I had a quadrectomy. My lump was only 1.6 cm though. Good luck. L
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: Hi I had a quadectomy in March. Only reason I know that is because it is in my notes and to be honest I am going to clarify at my next appointment as I thought the scaring would be more obvious. I am very large in the bust and whilst I can see a small difference once dressed it isn't really noticeable. The surgeon seemed to go in via the edge of my nipple and he got clear margins. I had a horrendous chest infection with me ending up on strong antibiotics just prior to my op. My dad had died 5 weeks previously and I developed the chest infection the day after the funeral and didn't get shot of it until a couple of days before my op. They will probably do a chest x-ray as standard and may do other tests if needed. I needed to know that my bc hadn't spread, even after having a negative snb so I was given MRI, CT and bone scan. Hope your op goes well whatever you decide. L
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, Your post sounds just like me.  I was diagnosed about 3 weeks ago, 5 weeks to the day after my dad died of cancer (he had been given 6 months 5 weeks previously) so I have been living a constant rollercoaster. I have 3 children aged 7 - 15 and I just pray I get long enough to see them all grown up. I have already had my op (quadrectomy and sentinel node biopsy) and start chemo next week followed by radiotherapy, herceptin and tamoxifen (I was greedy and had a triple positive hormone receptor test). I really hope everything goes well for you, keep posting, I find that lifts my mood.  One day you will feel up and another day you could feel down but keep talking.  Everyone is very supportive on here. L
Posts.Title: Scared!!

Posts.Content: Annie, glad your appointment when better than you hoped and you definitely sound a bit more positive. Great that you don't have long to wait until the start of chemo and you will definitely feel better to get that started. You consultant will have sorted the best chemo which covers the lungs and all so please step away from DR GOOGLE he doesn't know best. Feel free to message me if you want another person to share/scream at. I am a bit further down the line as I have just had my 3rd out of 8 chemo. L
Posts.Title: not toooo bad today

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, I am really sorry that you have an extremely insensitive onc. I am very fortunate that I have a lovely surgeon and onc. My surgeon refuses to use the word aggressive even though I know that is what Grade 3 means. Can I ask you what type and grade of bc you had and do you know what stage? When I was first diagnosed in March to be honest I had never heard any positive stories about bc but since then it turns out I actually know someone who is 40 years bc clear and 2 others who are 10 years clear. Everyone is different. I hope you are ok. L
Posts.Title: New here, and not sure if I should be - yet.

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, I am in much the same situation as yourself - lump removed March, still having chemo (last one next week) and then due to have radiotherapy. I was at onc today and he had a feel of the lump and has referred me back to surgeon who I am to see on Tuesday. Will be thinking of you and hope both our lumps turn out to be nothing. L
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, I am in much the same situation as yourself - lump removed March, still having chemo (last one next week) and then due to have radiotherapy. I was at onc today and he had a feel of the lump and has referred me back to surgeon who I am to see on Tuesday. Will be thinking of you and hope both our lumps turn out to be nothing. L
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Hi Carole I can't really advise on chemo as I start mine next week :( .  Like you my tumour was Grade 3 with clear margins and sentinel node was clear.  I am dreading chemo as well.  I am actually more worried about losing my eyebrows and eyelashes and I never go out without mascara.  It is the one piece of makeup I can't do without.  I am getting my wig fitted on Monday and I ordered a couple of scarves which are ok.  What I would say about the wig is, a friend of mine called to see me last week (she has just finished her chemo) and her wig looked fab.  If I didn't know it was a wig I would never have guessed. I really hope everything goes well with you.  It is a scary, awful time but I will be thinking of you. L
Posts.Title: Feeling Gutted
